ref: 9873 marāla2 ʻ soft, mild, tender ʼ lex. [Poss. MIA. < mlāna -- (> *malāla -- with assim. of l -- n) or *mlāta -- la<-> (cf. mlātá -- ʻ softened by tanning ʼ RV.) or *mlāka -- la -- (cf. malākā -- f. ʻ amorous woman ʼ lex.). -- √mlai?]

M. marā̆ḷ ʻ staying obstinately lying down and pretending exhaustion ʼ (= markaḷ, margaḷ with unexpl. k/g), maraḷ f. ʻ falling exhausted on the ground ʼ (scarcely with LM 383 an extention of mar -- ʻ to die ʼ).
